entries.meaning: (countable) The amount by which something goes too far.
examples: Let's see if we can predict and correct for the overshoot.

entries.meaning: (countable, ecology) When the population of a species exceeds its environment's carrying capacity.
(uncountable, typography, design) The portion of a letter extending above the capline of other letters of the same font, or the relative degree of such extent.

verbs.description: overshoot (third-person singular simple present overshoots, present participle overshooting, simple past and past participle overshot)

entries.meaning: To go past something; to go too far.
examples: When you drive, you must remember to not overshoot the parking space and end up with two wheels over the line.

entries.meaning: To shoot beyond; to shoot too far to hit something.
To pass swiftly over; to fly beyond.
(reflexive) To venture too far; to overreach (oneself).
